report.title: An Even Synergy
report.author: Murple
report.bodytext: 12:50AM /n ------- /n OK, so its actually the 18th now. So what. I haven't gone to sleep /n yet, so its the 17th as far as I'm concerned. Anyway... /n I have 2.5 tablets of Propacet, each containing 50mg of /n dextropropoxyphene. They're the last of a batch of 8 of them that I was /n given. I ingest all of them. I had smoked a little cannabis earlier, still /n feel a lingering effect, but am close to baseline. /n /n 1:09AM /n ------ /n I begin to feel a hint of opiate feel kicking in. I also seem to /n be feeling random itches all over my body, but they are easy to ignore. /n This is a typical opiate alert for me. I feel slightly warm, a little /n 'floaty,' and real calm. Not much else yet. Narcotics seem to take a long /n time to take effect orally. /n /n 1:21AM /n ------ /n The itching passed several minutes ago. But other than that, there /n has been no change. I almost even feel closer to baseline than at my last /n check-in. I'm yawning a little now though. /n /n 1:45AM /n ------ /n Well, I definitely feel 'something' - basically the same as I have /n been feeling, but its moved up a level of intensity. Its tempting at this /n point to smoke some cannabis to bring on the effects. I'm holding off /n though, so I can get a good description of an unclouded dextropropoxyphene /n experience. But damn... this slow come on time is a negative in my /n opinion. I would hate to have to wait this long if I were using it for /n pain relief! /n /n 2:10AM /n ------ /n T+1:20 and it still hasn't really kicked in yet. This is taking an /n unusually long time. I haven't eatin in 11 hours or so, so my stomach /n wasn't full. I feel slightly more than I did at last check-in. Same /n effects again, just a little stronger. A kind of warm tingly sensation /n diffused throughout my upper body and somewhat in my legs. A feeling of /n calmness. Somewhat quieted thought processes. But I'm not yet feeling the /n euphoria or the 'buzz' yet. /n /n 2:15AM /n ------ /n As I typed that last paragraph, things did jump up a level. The /n body tingles increased alot, and spread all over my body. There is some /n tinnitus in my ears now. Every now and then I get random itches, which has /n been going on since I felt the first hint of effects. I'm developing a /n decent 'buzz' and some euphoric sensations now as well. /n /n 2:30AM /n ------ /n Things still seem to be building, but I'm at a pretty decent level /n now. I feel typical opiate effects, though sort of mild. As I said, /n narcotics are very different from other CNS depressants. Its hard to /n compare this high to something like GHB or alcohol. /n I feel a little warm, its a pleasant warmth. My body feels a sort /n of tingly, floaty sensation. I feel much lighter than usual. I don't feel /n like moving around at all. I tried to lay down, though, and that wasn't /n noticably more comfortable than sitting in my computer chair or standing. /n It doesn't seem to matter what position I'm in, I'm equally comfortable. /n Its a comfortableness that seems to come primarily from not caring about /n things that might normally make me uncomfortable. My thought processes are /n slow... I'm a verbal thinker, and the voice in my mind is much quieter /n than normal. Its not that thought is impaired, I *can* think if I want /n to... it just seems nicer to not think though. Opiates are a very /n detatched high. You just want to float around feeling calm, not doing or /n thinking. Its not that you feel unusually happy - you just feel mentally /n relaxed and physically good. Personally I find it sort of boring, but I /n can see how this state would appeal to alot of people, especially those /n with escapist tendencies. Music is slightly enhanced. Orbital's 'Halcyon /n On & On' sounds prettier than usual, and goes well with the floaty /n sensations. Other minor effects... I have dry mouth, but its different /n than cannabis 'cottonmouth.' I was pretty hungry before I took the pills. /n The hunger vanished within a half hour or 45 minutes or so and hasn't /n returned. The itching is still somewhat there, but its so easy to ignore /n as to be a non-issue. Its concentrated on my scalp, face and arms now, /n though, whereas earlier it was all over. My juice tastes bland. /n /n 2:50AM /n ------ /n Its been 2 hours... peak plasma concentrations of /n dextropropoxyphene are supposedly reached at 2-2.5 hours, and I do feel as /n though I've gotten as far as I'm going to. There doesn't seem to be /n anymore sensation of increase in the effects. I'm kind of bored of the /n high already. Narcotics just don't do all that much for me on their own. /n I've been wanting to smoke some cannabis, but haven't yet because I wanted /n to write an accurate report of an unclouded narcotic high. I think I've /n accomplished that. /n /n 3:00AM /n ------ /n I smoke some cannabis. One hit from my glass pipe and I'm already /n feeling much nicer. Yes, I think this is what was needed. /n /n 3:15AM /n ------ /n The cannabis made a huge difference. I can feel the effects of /n both blended into a fuller high than the dextropropoxyphene alone. The /n cannabis also made me think more vocally again, and the combination makes /n mellow music AMAZING! It is making me a little sleepy though. Neither drug /n seems to dominate the high, its an even synergy, at least at these /n dosages. /n /n 3:45AM /n ------ /n I feel much the same as before, but the narcotic aspect of the /n high is starting to taper off ever so slightly. I'm pretty tired and plan /n to go to bed soon. This was interesting to actually document a narcotic /n experience, but I've never really been a big fan of this class of drug. /n I'd definitely do it again if I was given some more, although I'd combine /n it right off with cannabis. Ah well...
